definitions.definition: the edge or border of something.
examples: the eastern margin of the Indian Ocean

definitions.definition: the blank border on each side of the print on a page.
examples: leeway, latitude, scope, room, room to maneuver, space, allowance, extra, surplus there's no margin for error

definitions.definition: a line ruled on paper to mark off a margin.
an amount by which a thing is won or falls short.
examples: they won by a convincing 17-point margin
synonyms: difference "they won by a narrow margin"

definitions.definition: an amount of something included so as to be sure of success or safety.
examples: there was no margin for error

definitions.definition: the lower limit of possibility, success, etc.
examples: the lighting is considerably brighter than before but is still at the margins of acceptability

definitions.definition: a sum deposited with a broker to cover the risk of loss on a transaction or account.
provide with an edge or border.
examples: its leaves are margined with yellow

definitions.definition: annotate or summarize (a text) in the margins.
deposit an amount of money with a broker as security for (an account or transaction).
